text: We'll hear argument next in Number 98-1101, Rohn F. Drye v. United States.
Mr. Chief Justice, members of the Court, may it please the Court:
Well, of course, the IRS was not in Paradise.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
Mr. Jones, you don't have a stick that you're going to turn into a snake or anything like that, do you?
Well, it's...  the Government's changed his position a little bit.
The act of doing nothing is an affirmative act that cooks your goose.
The act of doing nothing is an affirmative act?
Let me contemplate that for a minute.
